script_segments.audio_text: Your brain is hardwired to keep you broke. And it has nothing to do with how much money you make.

broll_clips.search_query: person stressed empty wallet bills table

script_segments.audio_text: It is called present bias. A hundred dollars today feels more real to your brain than five hundred dollars next year. So saving feels like a threat, and spending feels like relief.

broll_clips.search_query: person impulse buying online shopping phone

script_segments.audio_text: This is why seventy percent of lottery winners go broke within five years. More money did not fix the pattern. It just amplified it.

broll_clips.search_query: person going broke debt financial stress

script_segments.audio_text: It is also why every time your income goes up, your expenses mysteriously rise to match it. That is not a discipline problem. That is your biology.

broll_clips.search_query: person upgrading apartment moving new home

script_segments.audio_text: The workaround: automate your savings before your paycheck ever touches your account. Remove the choice entirely. Your brain cannot spend money it never sees. Fifty dollars a month over thirty years becomes sixty thousand dollars.

broll_clips.search_query: person setting up automatic bank transfer phone
coins growing piggy bank savings jar
